Two men debate existence of ghosts.  
Raskolnikov feels irritated and defensive.  
Raskolnikov: “I know I’m not well!”  

Svidrigaïlov: “You should see a doctor.”  

---

<setup: tense atmosphere, deep conversation>  
Raskolnikov is frustrated and angry.  
Raskolnikov: “I don’t believe in ghosts!”  

Svidrigaïlov: “But what if they exist?”  

Raskolnikov: “That’s nonsense! They’re just fantasies!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov argues that ghosts may only appear to the sick, suggesting they are fragments of another world, while Raskolnikov vehemently denies their existence.
